info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 24 at 9:11AM CDT until May 27 at 9:25AM CDT by NWS Springfield MO
info.description:
...The National Weather Service in Springfield MO has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Missouri...
James River near Boaz affecting Stone and Christian Counties.
James River at Galena affecting Stone County.
Little Osage River near Horton affecting Vernon County.
For the James River...including Galena, Boaz...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Little Osage River...including Horton...Minor flooding is forecast.
* WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...Little Osage River near Horton.
* WHEN...From Sunday evening to late Tuesday morning.
* IMPACTS...At 41.0 feet, minor flooding affects low lying areas near the gage site and farmland along the river.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:45 AM CDT Saturday the stage was 39.3 feet. - Bankfull stage is 41.0 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise to 39.9 feet this afternoon. It will then fall to 39.7 feet just after midnight tonight. It will rise above flood stage late tomorrow evening to 41.2 feet Monday morning. It will then fall below flood stage late Monday morning. - Flood stage is 41.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 41.2 feet on 05/05/2013. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Many flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.
The next statement will be issued Sunday morning at 915 AM CDT.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM SUNDAY EVENING TO LATE TUESDAY MORNING
